definitions.text: the act of extinguishing; causing to stop burning

examples: The cold water quenched his thirst

definitions.text: put out, as of fires, flames, or lights
examples: Too big to be extinguished at once, the forest fires at best could be contained

definitions.text: electronics: suppress (sparking) when the current is cut off in an inductive circuit, or suppress (an oscillation or discharge) in a component or device
reduce the degree of (luminescence or phosphorescence) in (excited molecules or a material) by adding a suitable substance
cool (hot metal) by plunging into cold water or other liquid
